MajorClaims.MC1: as the privileged minority, wealthy nations have every reason to share their fortune with the poor
MajorClaims.MC2: wealthy nations' offering in need is not only a moral deed, but also a worthwhile one which will one day pay off in other ways

Claims.C1: Only those who sympathize with their fellowman can prosper in the long run
Claims.C2: it is inhumane to watch one's fellowman struggle against famine and poverty without doing anything to help, especially when the onlooker takes no effort to do so
Claims.C3: such aid could also create a win-win situation

Premises.P1: Compassion, a virtue preached in almost all religions from Buddhism to Mohammedanism, is what distinguishes us human beings from animals
Premises.P2: Underdeveloped nations no doubt receive direct benefits through such deeds
Premises.P3: For developed nations, new medical problems may very well arise from the work in underdeveloped nations
Premises.P4: related research is conducted accordingly to conquer the problem, promoting the development of the pharmaceutical industry
Premises.P5: The potential market in those poor countries, most of which has a huge population, is also a thing worth mentioning
Premises.P6: By building a good relationship with them, wealthy nations can not only broaden their global market, but also facilitate future international commerce
Premises.P7: The underdeveloped nations, in return, may export local agricultural products, mineral products with discount to the former, boosting each other's economy
